parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions the PSD-PNL-USR coalition and implicitly criticizes their actions. While it doesn't name specific candidates, the criticism is directed at parties participating in the parliamentary elections.  This partially fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a", but only indirectly.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, targeting a wide audience, not a private communication.  It addresses the general Romanian population, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post aims to influence voters' opinions about the PSD-PNL-USR coalition by highlighting negative aspects of their actions related to the election date and their stance on the presidential elections.  The objective is to discourage voting for this coalition, thus fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents opinions and criticisms, not factual reporting or neutral analysis. While it uses some factual elements (election date, coalition's stance), the overall tone and purpose are clearly aimed at influencing voters' choices, not providing objective journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>No. The post expresses a political opinion, but it's not a personal opinion unrelated to the election. The opinion is clearly intended to sway voters' choices.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>936673471712074</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by AUR - Sălaj de Sus, criticizes the PSD-PNL-USR coalition, linking their actions to the parliamentary elections.  While not explicitly advocating for a specific candidate, the post's clear intention is to negatively influence voters' perception of the coalition, thereby indirectly promoting AUR. The post's timing, close to the election, further strengthens this interpretation. The use of strong language ("toxic coalition," "false defenders of democracy") and the call for voters to "present themselves at the ballot box for a sovereign Romania" are persuasive techniques typical of electoral propaganda.  The image shows a gathering of AUR supporters, reinforcing the political message.  The post's reach (35K-40K impressions) and spend (RON600-RON699) indicate a significant effort to influence public opinion.  While the post doesn't directly mention specific candidates, the indirect impact on the election is undeniable.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>AUR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>AUR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
AUR - Sălaj de Sus, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 936673471712074), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu un buget de RON600-RON699, care atinge 35K-40K impresii,  conținând critici vehemente la adresa coaliției PSD-PNL-USR, asociind acțiunile acestora cu alegerile parlamentare și îndemnând implicit la vot împotriva lor, având un efect electoral clar în favoarea AUR.  Postarea, cu textul "Românii ar trebui să taxeze coaliția toxică PSD-PNL-USR din două motive...", utilizează un limbaj persuasiv și manipulativ,  încalcând prevederile legale privind propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.  Contact: iuliangros8@gmail.com, +40728044104, Bulevardul 22 Decembrie, bl. D3, Parter, Deva, Romania 330084, RO.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
